title: Fragment (France), late 19th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: continuous [ivory] and discontinuous [polychrome] suplementary wefts plus supplementary warps [ivory] in a plain weave foundation [ivory].
provenance: From the ex collection of Charles F. Ikle.
description: Fragments of an all-over pattern made up of a bunch of roses with trailing floral vine and a fine detached flowering vine arranged in a group.  The groups are placed side by side and reversed end to end to counter balance movements.  Polychrome pattern on an "ivory on ivory" geometric-patterned background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragment (France), late 19th century. Medium: silk
Technique: continuous [ivory] and discontinuous [polychrome] suplementary wefts plus supplementary warps [ivory] in a plain weave foundation [ivory]..
